intro: Bredia bullata, commonly known as the yellow bell, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers that resemble bells. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a slightly waxy texture. Bredia bullata thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, preferring well-drained soil and partial to full sunlight.
